TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

How can a user have a join date but the last visit says “never”? I get you can wipe that area away with anonymous log in so it does not show at all..

230602212021

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, AlamoVampire said:
> 
> 
> How can a user have a join date but the last visit says “never”? I get you can wipe that area away with anonymous log in so it does not show at all..
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 230602212021
> 

The forum has had a few engine changes in the past, and a few major hiccups, where data was not retained.   We haven't had one of those in many years though.   So it's possible either the "last visited" date wasn't retained in the switch over, or the old software didn't log that data to start with.
Was the KSP2 Dev Diary section hidden for months for some reason, or were all the posts just pre-dated back to when they were originally released?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, MechBFP said:
> 
> 
> Was the KSP2 Dev Diary section hidden for months for some reason, or were all the posts just pre-dated back to when they were originally released?
> 

The sub was not hidden. It was created and the content moved into it.

>

> 
> 
> The sub was not hidden. It was created and the content moved into it.
> 

I assume the content itself was hidden somewhere then? I can see that replies to the posts say stuff like "8 months later..."
I don't know, actually. Somebody from Squad set that up.

> Just now, Vanamonde said:
>

> What do you mean?
> 

some people say ''I'm on the forum'' and others say ''I'm on the forumS'', I know this is not relevant but what is the de jure right way to say it?

I don't think it really matters... but if you need a cut and dry, objective reason to pick one or the other...

Type [https://forum**s**.kerbalspaceprogram.com](https://forums.kerbalspaceprogram.com) into your address bar and lemme know how far you get. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

We can only surmise that the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> has poor knowledge in Latin ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

It really depends on the context. 

[http://latindictionary.wikidot.com/noun:forum](http://latindictionary.wikidot.com/noun:forum)

Pick your poison!
